text: Consider the following relation schema and a query that uses additional operators of relational algebra. 14, B, C); (4, D, E); {4, B, C, D, E); u(C, D, E); (rxas)Np +u What can be said about the result set if we write this query using only the 6 basic operators of relational algebra? (a) Result set of the basic-operator-query will be larger than result set of given query. (b) Result set will have attributes A and B only. (c) Some of the operations in query cannot be performed due to incompatible relation schemas. (d) Query cannot be written using only basic operators.
